snippet: Greyhound races attract fewer fans and now even the track owners are joining the fight to shut down the operations.
abstract: Greyhound racing track owners in Iowa, Florida and Arizona are joining animal rights groups in lobbying against their own industry; racetracks are hugely unpopular, and exist mostly as legal justification for the profitable casinos that are built up around them, costing owners millions of dollars; owners argue that they should be allowed to close tracks while keeping the casinos open, but so far the legislative outcome is in doubt.
lead_paragraph: Greyhound races attract fewer fans and now even the track owners are joining the fight to shut down the operations.

headline.seo: Greyhound Races Fade, With Many Track Owners Eager to Get Out
headline.main: Greyhound Races Face Extinction at the Hands of Casinos They Fostered
headline.print_headline: Greyhound Races Face Extinction At the Hands of Casinos They Fostered
